content.question: The graph of the piecewise linear function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown in the figure above. If <math alttext="g of x, equals, the integral from negative 5 to x, of, f of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.05em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, how many zeros does <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 5 comma 6, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
